implementation.name: App
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Main UI component that manages the state and orchestrates all task operations (add, edit, delete, mark as completed/pending) by calling API methods and rendering TaskForm and TaskItem components.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On mount:
    Call loadTasks to fetch all tasks from backend
On '+ Add Task' click:
    Open TaskForm for new task
On TaskForm submit:
    If editingTask is null:
        Call handleCreateTask (calls api.createTask)
    Else:
        Call handleUpdateTask (calls api.updateTask)
On delete button:
    Call handleDeleteTask (calls api.deleteTask)
On complete/pending toggle:
    Call handleToggleComplete (calls api.updateTask with toggled completed)
Render:
    TaskForm (for add/edit)
    List of TaskItem components for each task

implementation.name: TaskForm
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Form component for adding or editing a task. Collects title, description, priority, due date, and category (used as tag), and calls onSubmit with the data.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Render form fields:
    Title (required)
    Description
    Priority (Low/Medium/High)
    Category (tag)
    Due Date
On submit:
    Validate required fields
    Call onSubmit with all field values

implementation.name: TaskItem
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Displays a single task with its details and provides buttons to edit, delete, or toggle completion status. Calls parent handlers for these actions.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Render task details:
    Title, Description, Priority, Category, Due Date
Render buttons:
    'Done'/'Undo' button calls onToggleComplete
    'Edit' button calls onEdit
    'Delete' button calls onDelete

implementation.name: read_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to fetch all tasks. Called by frontend to display the list of tasks.
implementation.pseudo_code:
@app.get('/tasks')
    Return database.get_tasks()

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to add a new task. Receives all task fields from frontend and calls database.add_task.

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to edit an existing task. Receives updated fields and calls database.update_task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
@app.put('/tasks/{task_id}')
    Call database.update_task with task_id and TaskCreate data
    If not found, raise 404
    Return updated Task

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to delete a task. Calls database.delete_task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
@app.delete('/tasks/{task_id}')
    Call database.delete_task with task_id
    If not found, raise 404
    Return success message

implementation.name: add_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Creates a new Task object with all fields, assigns a UUID, saves to storage, and returns the new task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
def add_task(task_create):
    tasks = get_tasks()
    new_task = Task(id=uuid, **task_create fields)
    tasks.append(new_task)
    save_tasks(tasks)
    return new_task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Updates an existing task with new field values, saves, and returns the updated task.

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Removes a task by id from storage.
implementation.pseudo_code:
def delete_task(task_id):
    tasks = get_tasks()
    tasks = [t for t in tasks if t.id != task_id]
    save_tasks(tasks)
    return True if deleted, else False

missing_implementations: A new task must include a tag (the UI uses 'category' as a tag, but it is not required and can be empty; the backend does not enforce presence of tag/category).

implementation.name: App
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Main UI component that manages the list of tasks (events), handles opening the form for adding/editing, and delegates CRUD operations to the API.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On mount:
    Call api.getTasks() to load all tasks
On '+ Add Task' button click:
    Open TaskForm for new task
On edit button click for a task:
    Open TaskForm with task data
On TaskForm submit:
    If editing, call handleUpdateTask
    Else, call handleCreateTask
On delete button click for a task:
    Call handleDeleteTask
Display tasks using TaskItem components

implementation.name: TaskForm
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Form UI for adding or editing a task (event). Collects title (name), description, and other fields. On submit, calls the provided onSubmit handler.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Display form fields:
    Title (required)
    Description (optional)
    Priority, Category, Due Date
On submit:
    Validate title is present
    Call onSubmit with form data

implementation.name: api.createTask
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Sends a POST request to the backend to create a new task (event) with the provided data.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Send POST request to /tasks with task data
If response is not OK, throw error
Return created task

implementation.name: api.updateTask
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Sends a PUT request to the backend to update an existing task (event) with new data.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Send PUT request to /tasks/{id} with updated task data
If response is not OK, throw error
Return updated task

implementation.name: api.deleteTask
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Sends a DELETE request to the backend to delete a task (event) by ID.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Send DELETE request to /tasks/{id}
If response is not OK, throw error

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint for creating a new task (event). Receives TaskCreate data and calls database.add_task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On POST /tasks:
    Receive TaskCreate data
    Call database.add_task
    Return created Task

implementation.name: add_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Creates a new Task object with a unique ID and saves it to the database (JSON file).
implementation.pseudo_code:
Load tasks from file
Create new Task with unique ID and provided data
Append to tasks list
Save tasks to file
Return new Task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint for updating an existing task (event). Receives TaskCreate data and calls database.update_task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On PUT /tasks/{task_id}:
    Receive TaskCreate data
    Call database.update_task
    If not found, raise 404
    Return updated Task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Updates an existing Task in the database (JSON file) with new data.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Load tasks from file
Find task by ID
If found:
    Replace with updated Task
    Save tasks to file
    Return updated Task
Else:
    Return None

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint for deleting a task (event) by ID. Calls database.delete_task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On DELETE /tasks/{task_id}:
    Call database.delete_task
    If not found, raise 404
    Return success message

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Removes a Task from the database (JSON file) by ID.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Load tasks from file
Remove task with matching ID
If removed:
    Save tasks to file
    Return True
Else:
    Return False

missing_implementations: A new event must include a name, description, and location.
Multiple tasks can be assigned to a single event.
